Key Arguments: The bill threatens fundamental democratic principles such as freedom of speech and opinion.
Determining what constitutes misinformation or disinformation is subjective and speculative.
Delegating the responsibility of identifying misinformation to a panel is problematic and dangerous.
The proposed penalties for misinformation are excessive and disproportionate.
The bill exempts government and academia, creating a double standard.
Notable Quotes: This proposed bill attacks the most fundamental principles of our democratic society, namely freedom of speech, freedom of opinion and the right to share diverse ideas.
To classify a particular point of view as misinformation is arbitrary and may exclude valuable insights inherent in a specific perspective.
This bill is an affront to our freedom and reflects the modus operandi of totalitarian regimes, rather than that of our democratic society.
